Physics (Thermodynamics).subject: Physics (Thermodynamics)
Physics (Thermodynamics).question: Half portion of a rectangular piece of ice is wrapped with a white piece of cloth while the other half with a black one. In this context, which one among the following statements is correct?
options: Ice melts more easily under black wrap
Ice melts more easily under white wrap
No ice melts at all under the black wrap
No ice melts at all under the white wrap
Physics (Thermodynamics).answer: Ice melts more easily under black wrap
Physics (Thermodynamics).explanation: Ice under black wrap will melt easily because dark colour (black) absorbs the most of light energy falling on it.

Physics (Thermodynamics).subject: Physics (Thermodynamics)
Physics (Thermodynamics).question: Mr X was advised by an architect to make outer walls of his house with hollow bricks. The correct reason is that such walls
options: help keeping inside cooler in summer and warmer in winter
prevent seepage of moisture from outside
Physics (Thermodynamics).answer: help keeping inside cooler in summer and warmer in winter
Physics (Thermodynamics).explanation: The hollow bricks provide thermal insulations; the air in hollow bricks, does not allow outside heat or cold in the house to go out or come in the house. So, it keeps house cool in summer and warm in winter.

Physics (Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Properties of Matter)
Physics (Properties of Matter).question: In scuba-diving, while ascending towards the water surface, there is a danger of bursting the lungs. It is because of
Physics (Properties of Matter).explanation: As scuba driver ascends towards the water surface, water pressure decreases, so according to Boyle's law air in his lungs expands to occupy a greater volume. Which increase the chances of bursting the lungs.

Physics (Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Properties of Matter)
Physics (Properties of Matter).question: If a ship moves from freshwater into seawater, it will
Physics (Properties of Matter).explanation: When a body is immersed in a fluid, the fluid exerts an upward force on it, called buoyant force. Here buoyant force µ density of fluid. As the density of sea water is higher than that of the fresh water. So extra buoyant force and ship will rise a little higher.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: The blackboard seems black because it
Physics (Optics).explanation: Blackboard absorbs all the colours of light falling on it and does not reflect any colour due to which it appears black.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: Viewfinders, used in automobiles to locate the position of the vehicles behind, are made of
Physics (Optics).explanation: In automobiles, convex mirror is used as a rear view mirror because the image of the vehicle formed is small in size due to this the field of view is increased and the driver of automobile can see the traffic over large area.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: Due to contraction of eyeball, a long-sighted eye can see only
options: farther objects which is corrected by using convex lens
farther objects which is corrected by using concave lens
nearer objects which is corrected by using convex lens
nearer objects which is corrected by using concave lens
Physics (Optics).answer: farther objects which is corrected by using convex lens
Physics (Optics).explanation: The contraction of eyeball brings about in a long- sighted eye. To see the nearby objects, a convex lense is used.

Chemistry (Electrochemistry).subject: Chemistry (Electrochemistry)
Chemistry (Electrochemistry).question: When items or jewellery made of metals such as copper or nickel are placed in a solution having a salt of gold, a thin film of gold is deposited by
Chemistry (Electrochemistry).explanation: The process of depositing a thin layer of one metal over the surface of other metal by the process of electrolysis is known as electroplating. Hence, when items or jewellery made of metals such as copper or nickel are placed in a solution having a salt of gold, a thin film of gold is deposited by passing an electric current.

Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).question: Heavy water implies
options: water which is used in heavy industries such as thermal power plants
water which contains SO42- and CI– of calcium and magnesium
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).explanation: Heavy water or deuterium oxide (D2O) is an oxide of deuterium which is an isotope of hydrogen.

Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).question: Which one among the following metals is used for making boats because it does not corrode by sea water?
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).explanation: Titanium (Ti) metal is used for making boats because it does not corrode by the sea water.

Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Organic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).question: Which one among the following is a sin smelling agent added to LPG cylinder to help the detection of gas leakage?
Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).explanation: Ethyl mercaptan or thioethanol (C2H5SH) is added during filling of LPG cylinders. It is a strong smelling compound and help in the detection of gas leakage.

Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Organic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).question:
Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists.
List I (Acid) List II (Source)
A. Lactic acid 1 Tamarind
B. Tartaric acid 2 Orange
C. Oxalic acid 3 Tomato
D. Citric acid 4 Sour curd
Code:
A B C D A B C D
Chemistry (Organic Chemistry).explanation:
Lactic acid occurs in sour curd.
Tartaric acid occurs in tamarind.
Oxalic acid occurs in tomato.
Citric acid occurs in all citrus fruits like orange, lemon etc.

Chemistry (General Concepts).subject: Chemistry (General Concepts)
Chemistry (General Concepts).question: A body is charged negatively. It implies that
options: it has lost some of its protons
it has acquired some electrons from outside
it has lost some of its electrons
Chemistry (General Concepts).answer: it has acquired some electrons from outside
Chemistry (General Concepts).explanation: Atoms are neutral. When an atom loses electron, it becomes positively charged and when an atom gains electron, it becomes negatively charged. Hence, a body is charged negatively when it has acquired some electrons from outside.

Chemistry (Polymers).subject: Chemistry (Polymers)
Chemistry (Polymers).question: Contact lenses are made from
Chemistry (Polymers).explanation: Contact lenses are made from lucite. It is a polymer of methyl methacrylate. The other names of lucite are plexiglass, acrylite and perspex.

Chemistry (Physical Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Physical Chemistry)
Chemistry (Physical Chemistry).question: Water is a good coolant and is used to cool the engines of cars, buses, trucks etc. It is because water has a
Chemistry (Physical Chemistry).explanation: Water has a high specific heat.

Chemistry (Physical Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Physical Chemistry)
Chemistry (Physical Chemistry).question: Which one among the following would expand the most on being heated.
Chemistry (Physical Chemistry).explanation: Air would expand the most on being heated.

Chemistry (States of Matter).subject: Chemistry (States of Matter)
Chemistry (States of Matter).question: A close bottle containing water at room temperature was taken to the Moon and then the lid is opened. The water will
Chemistry (States of Matter).explanation: The water will freeze because on Moon the temperature is below the freezing point i.e., very low.

Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).subject: Chemistry (Chemical Reactions)
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).question: Which one among the following substances evolves heat when dissolved in water?
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).explanation:
When calcium oxide or quicklime (CaO) is dissolved in water, calcium hydroxide or limewater is obtained and there is a release of heat.
CaO + H2O ® Ca(OH)2 +Heat
Quicklime Lime water

Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Applied Chemistry)
Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).question: Dead organs are generally stored in formalin. Formalin is beacuse it acts as a disinfectant which is due to the presence of formaldehyde
Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).explanation: Formalin contains 40% aqueous solution of formaldehyde. Dead organs are preserved in 10% formalin solution.

Biology (Human Diseases).subject: Biology (Human Diseases)
Biology (Human Diseases).question: Insects that can transmit diseases to human are referred to as
Biology (Human Diseases).explanation: Insects that transmit diseases to humans are known as vectors. Insects may carry infection mechanically on feet or mouth parts, by passage through the digestive tract but without the insect being infected or by becoming an intermediate host with some part of the parasite’s life cycle occuring in the insect tissue.

Biology (Human Diseases).subject: Biology (Human Diseases)
Biology (Human Diseases).question:
Which of the following diseases are transmitted from one person to another?
1. AIDS
2. Cirrhosis
3. Hepatitis B
4. Syphilis
Select the correct answer using the code given below
Biology (Human Diseases).explanation: Cirrhosis is a only disorder which is caused due to excessive drink of alcohol or hepatitis. All the other three disorders are infectious diseases and transmitted from one peron to another.

Biology (Human Diseases).subject: Biology (Human Diseases)
Biology (Human Diseases).question: Which one among the following is not correct about Down's syndrome?
options: Effected person has furrowed tongue with open mouth
Biology (Human Diseases).explanation: Down’s syndrome is characterised by an extra chromosome 21. It is also known as trisomy 21. All the given characters are observed in Down’s syndrome, except option (b) only early ageing which is the symptom of progeria disease.

Biology (Human Diseases).subject: Biology (Human Diseases)
Biology (Human Diseases).question: Dog bite can cause rabies. Which among the following other animals can also cause rabies?
Biology (Human Diseases).explanation: Some bats are sanguivorous feeding on animal blood. When it sucks the blood of an animal which is suffering from rabies, it can cause rabies if it bites another animal or man.

Biology (Ecology & Environment).subject: Biology (Ecology & Environment)
Biology (Ecology & Environment).question: Photochemical smog occurs in
Biology (Ecology & Environment).explanation: Photochemical smog takes place in warm, dry and sunny climate.The word smog means ‘smoke’ and ‘fog’ means ‘smoky fog’. Its main components are created from the action of sunlight on unsaturated hydrocarbons and nitrogen oxide produced by automobiles and factories.

Biology (Ecology & Environment).subject: Biology (Ecology & Environment)
Biology (Ecology & Environment).question: Which one among the following industries produces the most non-biodegradable wastes?
Biology (Ecology & Environment).explanation: The most non biodegradable wastes are produced by thermal power plants. They utilize radioactive elements as raw material and thus evolves radioactive wastes which takes a very long period (hundreds of years) for losing its radioactivity completely.

Biology (Ecology & Environment).subject: Biology (Ecology & Environment)
Biology (Ecology & Environment).question: Which one among the following group of items contain only biodegradable items?
options: Fruit peels, Lime juice, China clay cup
Biology (Ecology & Environment).explanation: All the three items are organic matter and produced by living organisms thus are biodegradable wood is obtained from trees and leather is obtained from the hides of animals. Glass is acquired naturally or by melting silicates.

Biology (Botany).subject: Biology (Botany)
Biology (Botany).question: In dry regions, the leaf size of a tree becomes smaller. It is so to
Biology (Botany).explanation: The small leaves possess no or very few stomata thus the loss of water by transpiration is decreased and protects the plant from dehydration.

Biology (Botany).subject: Biology (Botany)
Biology (Botany).question: Why do you feel cool under a tree but not so under a tin shed on a sunny day?
options: The greenness of the tree gives the cool feeling
The leaves convert water vapours into water which is a heat-absorbing process
The leaves give out water which vapourises absorbing some heat as latent heat
Biology (Botany).answer: The leaves give out water which vapourises absorbing some heat as latent heat
Biology (Botany).explanation: The transpiration takes place from the leaves surface all the time. The water taken out from leaves absorbs heat from the surrounding atmosphere to vapourise so the area under a tree becomes cool.

Biology (Zoology).subject: Biology (Zoology)
Biology (Zoology).question: Bats can fly in dark because they
Biology (Zoology).explanation: Bats can fly in dark because they transmit ultrasonic waves. The bats have very poor vision. It cannot see in dark. It produces ultrasonic waves striking with the obstacles present on its path. The bat receives its echo and changes its path to protect itself from collision.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: White blood cells act
options: as a medium for oxygen transport from lungs to tissues
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: White blood cells destroy foreign proteins (bodies) e.g pathogens by the process of phagocytosis and in this way protects the body from infection.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: When we eat something we like, our mouth waters. This is actually not water but fluid secreted from
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: Salivary glands secrete amylase enzyme (ptyalin) and water to moist the food and to digest starch. When we see, smell or eat something we like, the salivary glands are stimulated and secrete saliva in buccal cavity thus watering the mouth.

Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry)
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).question: Rain water collected after 30 to 40 minutes of raining is not suitable for drinking because it
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).explanation: After raining for 30-40 minutes, the pollutants present in atmosphere come down with raining water that raise its pH upto 5.6 making it acidic in nature.

Biology (Human Health).subject: Biology (Human Health)
Biology (Human Health).question: Which one among the following elements/ions is essential in small quantities for the development of healthy teeth but causes mottling of the teeth if consumed in higher quantities?
Biology (Human Health).explanation: Fluoride is essential in small quantity for the protection of the teeth but in high quantity it causes fluorosis deforming the teeth.
